intro: Perityle gracilis, commonly known as the slender perityle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its slender stems and small, white flowers make it a subtle yet distinctive species in its native environment. Perityle gracilis is often found in association with other members of the parsley family, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
